lead_paragraph: STANIFORD--Rockwell Simpson. Age 96, died peacefully at his home in Vero Beach, FL, April 22, 2016. Survived by his wife of almost 70 years, Frances Ingersoll Staniford (Cricket), daughters, Carolyn Staniford Sollis, Martha Staniford Myers and Virginia Staniford Reid, grandsons, Edwin Bryant Sollis II, Jonathan Gardner Sollis, Alexander Rockwell Reid and numerous nieces and nephews. Born in Brooklyn, NY, Rocky was a WWII veteran serving in the Pacific arena in the US Coast Guard as Capt. of the LST 168. He spent many years in Westhampton Beach, NY and his working life in Rochester, NY where he was an active volunteer and Capt. of the Brighton Fire Dept. He retired to Fenwick, CT and Vero Beach. A memorial service will be held this summer in Fenwick. Contributions in his name may be made to: Save Plum Island www.ctenvironment.org 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  STANIFORD, ROCKWELL SIMPSON
